Header: Permanent deeds will be given to all those who had received state lands; PM
Content: Prime Minister RanilWickremasinghe has said that permanent land deeds will be provided to all those who had received state land. He made this reference at a function organized for the handing over of title deeds in Nikaweratiya. 10,000 persons received land deeds at a function organized at the Police College Grounds at Nikaweratiya in Kurunegala. The Prime Minister handed over land deeds to many state establishments which had so far not possessed these deeds. These include the Police, schools and hospitals. Prime Minister RanilWickremasinghe said that when many receive money or lands, they do not possess deeds. Sometimes if the officer decides to evict them they have to go. As such their main obligation is to provide title deeds to the farmers who had made the country self-sufficient in rice. The secondÂ  stage is to enact regulations to convert them into permanent deeds. When the Speaker signs this law, more than ten thousand will receive permanent deeds. Minister AkilaVirajKariyawasam said that if this proposal put forward to the Cabinet four years ago was approved, they could have traversed on a long journey. Deputy Minister IndikaBandaranayake and Minister GayanthaKarunatilake also addressed the gathering. Minister GaminiJayawickremaPerera, State Ministers J.C. Alawathuwala and Ashok Abeysinghe and Deputy Minister NalinBandara were among those who joined in the occasion.
